On the first glance you will feel the premium quality of the Oneplus 8.I have mentioned few good and bad points for quick understanding for every buyer -Good -Very good build qualityVivid displayExcellent performance and softwareSolid battery lifeDecent camera performanceChic designConsistent performanceOxygen OS is blissClass-leading displayBad-No IP rating or wireless chargingLow-light video could be betterBasic cameras setup

Obviously, you might have done extensive research, watched many review videos before coming here to make your purchase decision. There is only one way you will be happy with this purchase and that is, if you are looking for a slim, elegant, powerful, light weight device offering a premium in-hand feel. Camera is going to serve you well on many occasions (when the lighting is good). People might have told you that the camera system is mediocre. There have been few software updates and I can confidently say that yes, the camera is neither great nor is it bad. It delivers decent pictures (when the lighting is good) and if you are not a absolute camera geek, then this will meet and succeed all of your expectations. Incase you are a camera geek, then get the 8Pro and dont think about saving money. Conclusion: Feels expensive and has a nice balance in the hand (Its very light and is a joy to use). The glacial green in matte finish is makes the front of the device look expensive (with the dark edge-to-edge AMOLED panel).

After reading a lot of geeky reviews on YouTube and portals, I bought Oneplus7t. Pls, note I have been using OnePlus from last many years now so my expectations were clear. My experience with the device says that most of the reviews or unboxing things are influenced. Pls, note I have bought it with my own money unlike leading reviewers or unboxing video geeks who get it for free. Go for users reviews who bought them with their own money. So I am writing my 5 days experience with the phone. A regular user who wants to do all the office work on the phone, social media, blogging and vlogging, etc. The last OnePlus phone I was using was Oneplus 5 and was quite happy with it until it screen got broken and replacement cost was higher than the selling price of the device itself. I have clicked a magazine cover picture with my Oneplus 5 which had only 16 MP camera but pic quality was natural and good. Battery:  Battery is avg. All those time I teased my iPhone or Samsung Series colleagues and friends for their battery life. This offers an avg battery life. I never carried a charger with me in previous models if I Start with 90% even after two years. I m wondering what would be this phone battery life in a year or more.4. 90 Hz refresh rate is a gimmick to sell this device. It will give you fluid experience but the soon it consumes battery you will always prefer to keep it to 60hz which is an option given in the display settings. If you always stick to a desk or have a power source around you can keep it to 90hz. Not for people who are on the move most of the time. Sound: Phone calls are not crisp and clear. At times the caller's voice gets hazy and husky. Voice is even audible to person the person sitting next to me. Speakers volume is loud but the sound quality is not good.6. With multiple variants, it has joined the league of Samsung, Mi, Oppo, Vivo. Now they are launching 7t pro on Oct 10 again it is a disappointment for those who bought 7t on day 1. Maybe their R&D or trials have some problem here that in every two months they are launching a new device with an update to the previous faults. Like OnePlus 7 has voice receiver on one side which is right. So if you take calls or hear the phone from left you won't get a clear voice or volume. So they added receivers on both the side in this device. No camera quality, no battery life, no sound quality on calls, getting wounds on holding it for long. I have always recommended OnePlus devices to everyone around and had high hopes and trust on the brand that I bought it on the day of the launch but with this experience, I won't recommend OnePlus 7t to my colleagues and friends who are planning to upgrade their devices.
model: OnePlus 7T (Glacier Blue, 8GB RAM, Fluid AMOLED Display, 256GB Storage, 3800mAH Battery)

text: And it took me 40 min to charge from 2% to 100%.PROS:CAMERA - 4.8/5BATTERY- 5/5Display - 4.7/5Performance - 4.8/5Speed - 5/5Gaming experience- 4.8/5CONSNO
model: OnePlus 7T (Glacier Blue, 8GB RAM, Fluid AMOLED Display, 256GB Storage, 3800mAH Battery)

text: i am using this phone just a day..but there are  two main problem i notice so far...one is in video black depth is more and the second one is adapive light censor is worst part.in low light it's horrible.it can't match half of the samsung note,or s mobile.battery back is good far better than samsung and processor is absolutely powerful.playing pubg isn't that great experience it's lag many time.pls oneplus fixed lowlight display problem..

It was amazing at first,blazing fast speed,120hz refresh rate and the display was gorgeous to look at,but after around 9th day,my display was having issues and after 11 days,half the screen would show a weird purple tint while watching youtube in dark mode and using chrome and apps with similar black color.

I've played PUBG quite a lot on this device and have not noticed any major frame drops at HDR graphics and Extreme frame rates, let alone Smooth graphics. It runs PUBG really smoothly. Buttery smooth at all times.

My oneplus 8 pro has this screen uniformity issues in low brightness. During charging its heat a lot .Front camera of this phone is Just pathetic. In whatsapp video call is worse. Even with default camera app,the front camera is bad. Back camera is decent. First time i am disappointed with OnePlus.

====+ Faster Processor. Snapdragon 855 Plus.+ Adreno 640. Better Gaming Performance.+ Better Haptic Motor. Same as the 7T.+ Fast Charging. You would never want to get back to 60Hz once you're used to this.==== Performance ====Snapdragon 855 Plus is one of the best CPUs out there (at the time of writing this review) and with Adrena 640, it takes gaming and multi-tasking to another league. Stock Android was butter smooth while I missed out on a lot of simple gestures like Longer Screenshots, Silence Button, Customized Navigational elements & much more which lacked on the Stock OS from Google. I would say Oxygen OS should be set as a benchmark for Google to include these incremental features on their upcoming flagships. Oxygen OS has presently the best OS Experience for Android.==== Battery ====Warp T30 is super fast. Although not the fastest charger in the industry, it still gets through a day on heavy usage.==== What could've been improved ====- Minor improvements on Camera.- If you still wish to own this but cannot afford the extra rupee on incremental updates (Fast Charging, 855 Plus) , my suggestion would be is to go for the OnePlus 7 Pro.
model: OnePlus 7T Pro (Haze Blue, 8GB RAM, Fluid AMOLED Display, 256GB Storage, 4085mAH Battery)

The build quality is good however the performance is not good.
The phone lags and has several bugs. The ringer, Bluetooth and wifi has performance issues and turns on off or disconnects automatically.

Slow-Mo working fine. 30 W Warp charger  chage the device very fast. Fingerprint sensor is superfast. Face unlock also superfast. Qualcomm announced that its 865 Snapdragon processor support NavIC system.
The Ultramarine Blue is fantastic 😍.Finally, if the price is not a deal breaker, then I *Highly Recommend* this "Flagship" phone from OnePlus.

I am a long time customer of oneplus phones and since last 3 years I have been using oneplus 5 and that phone is as good as new. Here are some of the issues I am facing with the new onplus 8 pro.- Battery - The phone doesn't last one day with full charge. I dont play any games, my phone usage is mainly social media, instagram,facebook,reddit, twitter and bunch of other photo edit tools like lightroom and snapseed. If I charge full and start my day, then by evening 8pm  my phone is battery saver mode. Which is not the case on my oneplus 5 even after 3 years. And its more concerning because I don't use any of the power hungry games or apps. Btw I have removed 120hz refresh rate on the first week itself and all this battery issue is even when I am using it at 60hz refresh rate with default app/battery settings. I bought the oneplus 8 pro selling my DSLR camera so that I can record all my videos on phone itself plus its waterproof. Recently I shot a video at 4k 60fps and I guess within few minutes the phone got so heated that it disabled the camera from video shooting until the phone cooled down!! Now whats the use if I cant record a video even for few minutes straight on 4K?Camera - To be honest, stabilization is really great while recording video however photos are almost as good as oneplus 5 if not slightly better. But nothing that worth paying double the price you pay over oneplus 5. Video clarity is really great, far better than the oneplus 5. Wide angle is the only thing I felt is worth compared to oneplus 5.Apart from the above rest of the things are good I feel. Fingerprint lockscreen works mostly 70% of the time. Overall I regret buying the phone. Even if they had fixed the battery issues, this phone would have been a great choice.
Yes war charging is faster, but the charge which doesn't last one full day is conerning for me.
As a title it is obviously a monsterAnd very very good performance
If someone is looking for great flagship. But it don't deserve to be a flagship phone.
Pros: fast phone, 24 hours + battery backup, wonderful screen, no hanging, no lagging, optimzed oxygen OS.Cons:

The touch is super smooth, face unlock is fast as a blink of an eye, I constantly use google assistant which response pretty well, I am blown away with the camera quality and audio quality that is powered by Dolby Atmos. The phone connects pretty fast to wifi and Bluetooth devices.
Awesome experience with ONEPLUS.Buttery smooth 90 hz display 😍Color accuracy and brightness of displayYou will be just in love with display of device.

You'll understand why I rated this phone 2 out of 5 🌟. Battery backup is not like Op6 (OP6 had better).My OP6 had some issues like disappearance of networks and rebooting again and again. Now after 3 days of use same issue happened in OP8 too, like disappearance of networks n power button wasn't working I had to use power button+ volume up+ volume down altogether to reboot it again which was highly disappointing and annoying too. Not only this when I play game at bottom of the screen I can see some disturbance too which u can c in screenshots and videos I uploaded with the review. There is no 3.5 mm jack if u don't want to switch to wireless headphones as I dn like to use wireless ones. Yesterday I set it to full brightness to worship outside in sunlight and I received a prompt in phone about my phone's temperature Go through the images n video n ull get to understand that y u shud wait for another version or look for another options.
Highly disappointed with its performance.
Also smoothness of phone.
I will not speak about the specs as most reviews highlight it in detailwhat I liked!Blazing fast  while opening closing apps etcCamera is quite good!
Quick processor2. Ultra fast storage4.

OOS 4.5.x looks and feels better than the version in 3/3T. I am sure the little issues will be taken care of, soon.7. AptX support for better wireless audio.8. Camera is better than 3/3T. Videos look great after update. Decent front camera. Amazing battery life. Speaker is louder than 3/3T for sure but sounds cheap.2. Sound via headphone jack is also better than 3/3T, but lacks the power to drive high quality headphones.3. Inbuilt equalizer is the worst there is. An update can easily fix that.4. Dual camera setup. OP should have opted for a wide angle combi instead of zoom. Pictures in low light are still noisy. The screen isnt as bright as 3/3t. Legibility under sunlight can be an issue for some. Also, same old 1080p can be a bummer. I personally dont mind the trade off for battery life.
Processor:

The OnePlus5 is the first phone in India to have the advanced Octacore 10-nanometer design Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 chipset. In the fast paced world, the faster the phone charges, the better it is. The Dash charge is incredibly fast as ever and will prove to be a big convenience.

Dash charge is very fast, within 30 min it will be enough charged, but the software upgrade is little buggy, some apps gets crashed and a popup comes in saying "___ app has stopped, open again",camera in day is excellent, but night needs improvement.

Look is of flagship grade... little bit slippery,so u need to buy back cover to protect it..rating:8/10Display: Display is much better than any LCD but not as great as samsung super AMOLEDs. Rating: 8/10Performance: For this only one word.. awesome!!! Great performance...no heating at all.. blazing fast processor.. Daylight photo quite good(samples attached).Night photo though manageable but not as great as samsung flagships..
Faster application speed than all the other phones, found better speed than my iPhone 6.3.
Phone is simply superb in all aspects...low light performance of the camera is outstanding...you simply cannot go wrong with this phone

This phone makes sense only for a very specific set of people. Bought this after a lot of deliberation on whether to go the one plus way or the oppo find x.  I am a person who uses an S9, and super heavy user. Atleast 2 full charges a day. emails, conf calls and video. In 30 min you get near full charge. This phone is worth for that one reason. Screen, a 120hz screen does make a huge difference compared to S9 that I own. Speaker - One of the best speakers. Plus 5k discount and a one-time screen replacement warranty. I don't worry about IP68 and Camera. In the last 15 years, I have dropped the phone only once in the pool, but at least 5 of them have got a broken screen. I don't use the camera on the phone much. I just looked at how I have used the other phones for the last 10 years and counting what made sense for my usage leaving all other things out.
It is minimalist, material design, and fast.

text: I Love the iPhone Pro Max, purchased from Amazon IN, on Oct 14th 2019. That is the main reason I upgraded from iPhone X to 11 Pro Max. The Ultrawide lens, the improved telephoto lens, night mode, improved portrait options, all give exceptional results. The snaps taken by this phone could compete with some of the most professional DSLRs. I used to charge my iPhone X every night, whereas for the same amount of usage, now I have to charge the 11 Prod max once in 2 nights.3. I was already a big fan of the 5.8' OLED display on the iPhone X. At 6.5' , 11 Pro Max offers the best OLED display I have come across smartphones.4. The 11 Pro Max is definitely a phone for amateur & professional photographers.

Pros:1) A11 Bionic Processor is blazing fast and coupled with 3GB ram you will never have any issues with any of the heavy duty tasks you throw at it2) Snapdragon X16 LTE modem while the iPhone X A1901 has the Intel XMM 7480 modem) which is better than the A1901 model as A1865 covers more cellular bands (GSM and CDMA networks and frequencies) and the performance of Qualcomm’s chips has always been better than Intel’s.

Redmi phones cameras are great, of course iPhone is better but is the 6 more Redmi phones that I can get for 1 iPhone justifiable for such a difference in price? Well, absolutely yes.iPhone camera is not just better, it is so much better than comparing them are like comparing a Alto with BMW, yes both have 4 wheels, both have AC, both can run at 100 kmph, but you know the difference. The high price of iPhone is so justified by the sheer brilliance of camera it has. Sure it is just 12 MP, but the clarity, my o my!Sure the battery is just about 2600 compared to 3500 of a Redmi, but it lasts longer than a Redmi. My last iPhone was a 4S and then since I love buying phones every 6 months, I shifted to Android (Redmi, Samsung, Honor) to satiate my hunger for new phones. All these phones are superb, no doubt, but once you use the iPhone 7, you know that the difference between these phones and iPhone 6s has got much bigger because of the camera. Bottom line, iPhone 7 has jumped a big leap from the 6s and the 8 is almost similar. The X is double the price of a 7, so probably all things taken in account, the iPhone 7 is the best value for money among all phones in India
I don’t feel the need to upgrade to some other device (iphone 8, x or xs) because it works flawlessly without any lag or delay whatsoever.
